poem:
### Diplomatic Tango

Xi extends  
a silken hand—  
invites India to step  
through swirling tariff tides.  
In whispered letters,  
dances of trade  
twist silent shadows—  
gravity of tariffs  
brings a weightless buoyancy.  
In these steps,  
worlds converge,  
seeking grace in the  
unhesitating pause  
of a tango unanswered.  
Shall we dance?  
The floor is lonely.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China needs friends in Trump’s trade war. But Xi may have to go it alone China’s leader, Xi Jinping, says he is prepared to dance if it means sidestepping some of the worst of Donald Trump’s trade tariffs. Last week he sent a letter to India’s president, Droupadi Murmu, urging her to join him in a tango to celebrate 75 years of ­bilateral trade. Xi said it was “the right choice” for the two countries". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
